sources.title: A Farewell to Arms
sources.description: Title: A Farewell to Arms Summary: An American ambulance driver and an English nurse fall in love in Italy during World War I. Directed by: Frank Borzage Actors: Gary Cooper, Helen Hayes, Adolphe Menjou Production Company: Paramount Pictures Release Date: 8 December 1932 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 Color: Black and White A tale of the love between ambulance driver Lt. Henry and Nurse Catherine Barkley during World War I. The action takes place in Italy and the two fall in love during the war and will stop at nothing to be together. The film also analyses Lt. Henry's feelings on war and the purpose of fighting.

sources.title: A Farewell to Arms (1932)
sources.description: A tale of the World War I love affair, begun in Italy, between American ambulance driver Lt. Frederic Henry and British nurse Catherine Barkley. Eventually separated by Frederic's transfer, tremendous challenges and difficult decisions face each as the war rages on. Watch on RetroFlix:  https://retroflix.org/a-farewell-to-arms-1932/

sources.title: A Farewell To Arms (1932) [Colorized, 4K, 60FPS]
sources.description: A Farewell To Arms is a 1932 black and white movie film which has been colorised, upscaled to 4K, and frames per second boosted to 60 FPS in 2021 using Artificial Intelligence (A.I) and Google Colab @  https://colab.research.google.com   Technologies used: A.I. Colorizing:  https://github.com/jantic/DeOldify  A.I. Increasing frame rate 60 FPS:  https://rife-vfi.github.io   A.I. Upscaling to 4K:  https://ffmpeg.org   GPU: Google Colab. This movie is in public domain category and it is Copyright free.

sources.title: A Farewell To Arms (1932) GARY COOPER
sources.description: In Hemingway's WWI tale, an American ambulance driver and a British nurse fall in love to the displeasure of his jealous commanding officer.

sources.title: A Farewell to Arms (1932) GARY COOPER
sources.description:
Stars: Gary Cooper, Helen Hayes, Adolphe Menjou 
Director: Frank Borzage
Writer: Ernest Hemingway (Novel)

In Hemingway's WWI tale, an American ambulance driver and a British nurse fall in love to the displeasure of his jealous commanding officer.

metadata.Plot: A tale of the love between ambulance driver Lt. Henry and Nurse Catherine Barkley during World War I. The action takes place in Italy and the two fall in love during the war and will stop at nothing to be together. The film also analyses Lt. Henry's feelings on war and the purpose of fighting.
metadata.Writer: Benjamin Glazer, Oliver H.P. Garrett, Ernest Hemingway
metadata.Actors: Gary Cooper, Helen Hayes, Adolphe Menjou
